Articles.Content: Just like the title says, is it possible to convert mbm to png and then convert the png back to mbm? I find it's much easier to work with png files but I would like to convert them back to mbm when i'm done editing them.

If you change the mbm file extension to raw, you can open it with some image viewers, but you'll have to work out the colour depth and dimensions by trial and error. You can then save it as png.

Unity can convert your textures to mbm when you export your model.

You might as well work with TGAs to be honest. When compressed correctly (not by Unity) they look good and don't take much space.
Thanks for the feedback, is there a guide somewhere that will tell me how to use TGAs? I'm brand new to texturing so i'm winging things in an attempt to teach myself.

Sorry. All I know about it is what I noticed from doing thing myself. For some reason Unity compresses TGAs in a way that makes them a)larger and b)uglier, than TGAs compressed by GIMP.

So use GIMP to save TGAs for your models making sure the "compressed" check box is checked, and after you export your model from Unity, overwrite the TGAs that it creates with your originals.

Well no. It's possible evidently since Blackheart612 is doing it.

1. Grab the "mbm to png converter" on spaceport.

2. Use it on any mbm files you want to edit.

3. Rename the original .mbm files to .mbm.bak (so they won't load, and the pngs will load instead)

4. Edit the pngs to taste.
